MELEPER

The Boring-But-Important Rules for My **Co-op** VR Horror Game! (By Case)

1. Privacy Policy (AKA: I'm not a creep)

Last Updated: November 2025 (I wrote this!)

1.1 What I DO NOT Collect (I swear!)

The Meleper VR game is too busy being scary to steal your stuff. I promise I don't collect your Personal Information. This means I don't ask for or store your name, email address, age, phone number, or where you live. That's just creepy, and I'm a good person!

  • I don't track you outside of the game.
  • I don't have any data to share with anyone!
1.2 Game Data (Boring Stuff)

The game only saves boring stuff that helps it work, like your high score, what level you're on, or maybe if you turned the volume down because you got too scared. For **co-op games**, some of this data (like which player is the monster!) is saved on the game server while you play. But it’s still just game stuff, not your private stuff.

1.3 The Super-Secret Server Stuff (PlayFab)

Meleper uses stuff like PlayFab (backend services) to run the game (it's how the monster finds the survivors!). For **co-op multiplayer**, these services need technical info, like your device's **IP address**, just so your headset can find the other players and connect to the game server.

**PlayFab *does* technically give me access to some of your personal info** (like IP addresses) because it needs it to make the game work. But I choose NOT to look at it! Why? Because I would be uncomfortable if a random stranger knew where I lived, and I think it's wrong to look at yours! I only care about the anonymous game data.

1.4 Rules for Young Explorers (If you're under 13)

Meleper is a horror game—it's scary, like really scary. If you are under 13, you need a grown-up (parent or guardian) to say it's okay for you to play. Since I don't collect any personal info, I don't break any rules about kids online (called COPPA). You should always ask permission before downloading any games!

2. Player and Creator Rules (The Fun Rules)

Effective Date: November 2025

2.1 General Player Rules (Just be cool)
  • **Game Use:** Play the game for fun! Don't try to use it for big business stuff or selling it.
  • **Bugs:** The game is "as is." I'm 11 and still learning, so if the monster glitches through the wall, it's a bug! Tell me about it (see contact info) but please don't get mad.
2.2 Awesome Creator Rules (For YouTubers/Streamers)

I, the developer, own all the spooky code, scary sounds, and art.

  • **Make Videos!** You are totally allowed to record videos, stream, and share gameplay of Meleper on YouTube or Twitch! Please do!
  • **Give Credit:** You must never claim that you created or developed the game. **I did!** Always give credit to Meleper and me.
  • **Monetization:** You can make money from your videos (like ads on YouTube) because I said so! You do not need to ask me.
2.3 Cheating and Forbidden Mods (SERIOUSLY, DON'T)

**No Cheating:** Do not try to cheat, hack, or use programs that give you an unfair advantage over the monster or the survivors. That is the lamest thing you can do!

Strictly Prohibited Mods: You cannot make or use unauthorized mods, cheats, or anything that changes the official game rules. This is unfair to everyone else, and it's confusing. If I see illegal mods or cheats, I will ask the platform to shut it down, because I made this game to be fun and fair!

2.4 Being Nice (No Jerks Allowed)

Meleper is a co-op game, and we're all playing together (even the monster!). Please use common sense:

  • **Be Respectful:** Don't say mean or rude things to other players. No one likes a bully, especially in a spooky game.
  • **No Harassment:** Don't chase people around just to be annoying if they aren't having fun.
  • **Use the Mute Button:** If someone is being rude, just mute them and tell me about it!
2.5 Safety Tips from the Dev

Okay, real talk: Meleper can be seriously spooky. If you get scared easily (like, if you jump when a cat meows), maybe don't play alone in the dark! Play with friends or in a public place so you have someone to scream with. I'm just trying to help you stay safe (and maybe share the jumpscares).

2.6 How to Contact Me (If you found a crazy bug or just want to say 'hi')

If you have questions about these policies or the game, you can contact me directly:

  • Email (I check this!): casewhaley541@gmail.com
  • Discord Server (The best place for help!): Join the Meleper Discord

3. The Grown-Up Section (Important Stuff for Parents)

3.1 Can My Kid Play This Scary Game? (Is it okay?)

Hi Grown-Ups! This section is just for you. Please read this if you have questions about content and age!

  • **Horror Content:** Meleper is a VR horror game. It has jumpscares, creepy sounds, and can be intense. Please make sure your child is comfortable with this type of content and is within the recommended age range for the VR headset (usually 12+ or 13+).
  • **No Private Data:** I confirm that **I do not collect or store** any personal information about players (names, emails, etc.).
  • **Supervision:** Since it's online co-op, players talk to each other. Please supervise their online interactions to make sure everyone is being nice!
3.2 Money, Refunds, and Other Grown-Up Things
  • **Spending Money:** If I ever add stuff you can buy in the game (like a cool new monster skin), I will make sure the platform (like Meta/Steam) requires a password or something official so your kid doesn't accidentally buy 100 things.
  • **Refunds:** Any requests for refunds for the game or any in-game purchases have to go through the platform you bought the game on (like the Oculus Store or Steam). I don't handle that part!
3.3 The "I'm Not Responsible" Bit (The Legal Stuff)

This is the part where the grown-ups need to read the long words! Basically, I'm just a kid making a game, not a big company.

I am not responsible for any problems with your headset, your internet breaking, or your computer exploding (that won't happen, promise!). You play Meleper at your own risk. The game is provided "AS IS" without any warranties, which means I can't promise it will never crash or break, but I'll try my best to fix it!

4. Quick Check! Should YOU Play? (Fun Self-Assessment)

4.1 Can You Handle Jump Scares?

This game is meant to make you jump! If you think you might throw your headset across the room, maybe start with a less scary game.

  • **If you like being scared:** YES, come on in!
  • **If you cry when you see a shadow:** Maybe play with the volume down low first, or bring a friend!
4.2 Are You Okay Fighting a Monster?

Meleper is co-op! Sometimes you are running from the monster, and sometimes YOU ARE THE MONSTER!

  • **If you don't like losing:** You will lose sometimes. It's part of the fun!
  • **If you love teamwork:** You'll need to talk to your survivor friends to win. Be a good teammate!
4.3 Are You Safe in Virtual Reality?

Safety first! It's VR, so don't hit your TV!

  • **Did you clear your room?** Make sure you have lots of space to swing your arms without hitting your lamp.
  • **Are you standing on a rug?** A soft rug helps you know where you are in real life without taking off the headset.
  • **Listen to the Guardian:** If your VR system tells you to stop, STOP! I don't want you to get hurt.
4.4 Is Your Headset Charged? (Don't run out of battery!)

Nothing is scarier than running away from the monster and then the screen goes dark because your battery died!

**Pro Tip:** Always check your battery is at least 50% before starting a game of Meleper. Losing to the monster is okay, but losing to the battery is just sad.
